meanings.definition: The part of a solid figure that lies between two parallel planes.
meanings.sent1: The frustum of the pyramid was painted red.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a building with a frustum shape.
meanings.sent3: The frustum of the cake was missing, making it look like a half-eaten treat.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like a frustum, always just out of reach.
meanings.sent5: The frustum of the mountain stood tall against the sky.

meanings.sent1: The ice cream cone was shaped like a frustum.
meanings.sent2: The frustum of the pyramid was smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the frustum, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a frustum in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The frustum of the traffic cone warned drivers of the construction ahead.
